column4: Xcrossfire: if i am not mistaken there is something called wine and/or playonlinux for windows programs to work on linux
what is the command to move everything from one folder to another ?
mv oldDirectory/* newdir/
Ah, ok, so your destination ir /media/flash/
yes it is ... but i have a rootfs.cupcake folder ... the contents of that folder need to go to the /media/flash
cp rootfs.cupcake/* /media/flash/
i want to delete the cupcake folder
assuming you're in the directory where rootfs.cupcake also is
then delete i: rm -r rootfs.cupcake
didnt copy the folders
I told you to use cp to copy the contents of the folder
i did ... but it didnt copy the folders
i need the folders too
Which folders?
there is a dev sbin and a system folder in the rootfs.cupcake folder
need to copy them
Where is your folder rootfs.cupcake?
OK. So you want to copy all the files inside /media/flash/rootfs.cupcake to /media/flash/ ?
correct?
yep and delete the rootfs.cupcake folder
Gotcha. We'll use cp (recursively) to copy the files, then rmdir to remove the leftover empty directory.       cp -r /media/flash/rootfs.cupcake/* /media/flash/ && rmdir /mediaflash/rootfs.cupcake
cool thanks
Does that make sense?
yep got it .. thanks
